summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, denying motions to quash a subpoena for materials from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program. The order requires the Program Administrator to produce responsive materials and directs the parties to negotiate a protective order for review.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20-CR-330) who issued a Rule 17(c)(3) subpoena for materials from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The United States District Judge for the Southern District of New York who issued this order, denying motions to quash a subpoena and setting deadlines for production and protective order negotiation.

persons.name: Administrator Feldman
persons.role: Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program
persons.context: The administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program who filed a motion to quash the defendant's subpoena and requested oral argument, which was denied.

connections.description: Maxwell subpoenaed materials from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program, which Feldman administers; Feldman moved to quash the subpoena.
Judge Nathan is presiding over Maxwell's criminal case and issued this order regarding Maxwell's subpoena.
Judge Nathan denied Feldman's motion to quash the subpoena and ordered Feldman to produce materials to the court.

events.title: Court Order on Subpoena Motions
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan denied motions to quash Ghislaine Maxwell's Rule 17(c)(3) subpoena for materials from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

events.title: Deadline for Production and Protective Order
events.description: Deadline for the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program Administrator to produce subpoenaed materials to the court and for the parties to submit a proposed protective order.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Judge Alison J. Nathan denied motions to quash Ghislaine Maxwell's subpoena for materials from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.
The Epstein Victims' Compensation Program Administrator (Feldman) was ordered to produce responsive materials to the court by November 24, 2021.
The court indicated it would review the materials first and might allow party review under a protective order to avoid trial delay.
The parties were ordered to negotiate and submit a proposed protective order by November 24, 2021.
